H0.text: A stone rolling downhill is the best example of a wave.

H1.text: A vehicle traveling on a bumpy road is the best example of a wave.

H2.text: A string vibrating on a guitar is the best example of a wave.

H3.text: A grasshopper jumping up and down occasionally is the best example of a wave.

A4.text: A wave is a propagating dynamic disturbance (change from equilibrium) of one or more quantities.

A5.text: The transverse vibration of a string is a function of tension and inertia, and is constrained by the length of the string as the ends are fixed.
